newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent holds despite U.S. heating oil dip.
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent holds despite U.S. heating oil dip.

text.p: IPE Brent crude futures were steady at a slight loss on the day shortly after New York opened on Wednesday despite a slide in NYMEX heating oil.
November Brent was down 11 cents at $24.47 a barrel but 15 cents up on the day's low so far.
Dealers said U.S. government EIA stock statistics backed up Tuesday's API figures showing a build in distillate.
The EIA reported a 1.3 million build in U.S. distillates, in line with the API. The shortfall in stocks versus a year ago shrank by 1.6 million barrels to 17.1 million.
IPE gas oil was $2 a tonne down at $245 after opening at a high for the day at $248.
Dealers said gas oil might be underpinned by newly released Euroilstock data showing a growing year-on-year shortfall in European Union distillate stocks.
EU distillate stocks, excluding Sweden, at the end of September were 33.47 million barrels less than a year ago, compared to a 25.79 million deficit at end-August.
Distillates fell 2.93 million barrels to 283.35 million barrels during September, Euroilstock said.
